title: Bitcoin's Demise Is Inevitable
body: Summary Bitcoin's price surge is driven by hype, institutional adoption, and favorable political shifts, not by intrinsic value or improving fundamentals. Trading volumes and active addresses are declining, indicating weakening underlying activity despite rising prices and increased derivatives speculation. Bullish arguments based on HODL trends and futures activity are double-edged, often signaling overextension and a potential bubble rather than sustainable growth. Given deteriorating fundamentals and reliance on speculation, I maintain a 'strong sell' rating on BTC-USD, expecting a significant price collapse eventually. The problem with speculative bubbles is that you can be wrong for a long time before ultimately being proven right. This will likely prove to be especially the case when it comes to those who are bearish about Bitcoin ( BTC-USD ) and many other cryptocurrencies in general. I have argued for a while now that Bitcoin is destined to collapse. This is because it lacks any intrinsic value and is centered around hype and the premise of finding a bigger fool willing to pay more than you did. Recently, Bitcoin prices have been hitting all-time highs. This has been driven by increased adoption at the institutional level, for instance, with the growth of ETFs in the space. The Trump Administration also seems more open to cryptocurrency than previous administrations, which is also fueling the hype. In the short run, there's no telling how high prices will go. Would I be surprised if they double, triple, or more? No, I wouldn't. At the end of the day, I believe that it will drop, though. And I would also argue that there is mounting evidence that the underlying fundamentals are weakening. Because of this, I have no problem maintaining Bitcoin as a ‚Äòstrong sell‚Äô candidate. A Note on Speculative Bubbles I consider myself to be an avid reader of all things finance and economics. I am especially interested these days in the economic history of the Dutch Republic, but I digress. In recent years, one of the best financial books that I have read is Boom and Bust: A Global History of Financial Bubbles , which naturally talks about financial bubbles that have developed over the centuries. Some of these are bubbles that are household names. Others, like the British bicycle bubble, are unknown to the vast majority of society. In that book, the authors present the idea of the Bubble Triangle. Author Simply put, the Bubble Triangle represents the three elements needed in order for a speculative bubble to come into existence. These are marketability, money/credit, and speculation. Marketability refers to how easy it is to buy and sell the asset in question. Money and credit refer to how easy it is to access funds, whether because of government stimulus, broader societal wealth, or policies that make borrowing cheaper, which make it possible for the bubble to inflate. Speculation is the third and final element and refers to the idea that participants must believe that they can sell what they have purchased to somebody else at a higher price than what they paid for it. This could be a legitimate belief that the asset will appreciate based on intrinsic reasons. But often, it is rooted in the Greater Fool Theory. Even though these are the elements needed in order for a speculative bubble to come about, they almost always require fuel, or a catalyst if you will, in order to take off. Typically, this would be technology or changes in the political environment. I would argue that Bitcoin has experienced both, especially on the technology side. I firmly believe that blockchain technology is revolutionary and will play a big role in society in the long run. Bitcoin enthusiasts obviously believe that as well. Latching on to that, they have leveraged technology like easy trading around the clock, the benefits of blockchain offers, and more, to pump up Bitcoin. More recently, the political environment, at least in the US, has become more favorable to Bitcoin. In 2021, the Securities and Exchange Commission approved the first Bitcoin futures-based ETF. And in January of last year, they approved a Bitcoin spot ETF that granted investors the opportunity to buy into funds that actually held Bitcoin directly. Under the Trump Administration, the political environment has become even more favorable. In March of this year, Donald Trump signed an executive order establishing a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve that would be funded with Bitcoin seized by law enforcement. The Securities and Exchange Commission has dismissed enforcement actions against major companies such as Coinbase ( COIN ) and created a Crypto Task Force while simultaneously wiping out the National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team in an effort to soften criminal enforcement in this space. Most recently, Trump signed the GENIUS Act , which provided significant clarity for the use of stablecoins and will certainly further their adoption. In fact, at the time that development came out, I wrote an article about Visa ( V ), wherein I talked about what it means for that business. Even though many market participants might disagree with my overall assessment of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency more generally, as I mentioned already, I am a big believer in the potential for blockchain technology. When regulated appropriately, I also believe that stablecoins offer a unique opportunity for society. But Bitcoin specifically, and other cryptocurrencies like it that are not backed by anything, are, I believe, destined to drop precipitously. I don't know if they deserve to fall to $0. However, I do think that they deserve to fall pretty close to it. The Data Isn‚Äôt Looking Good Author - Data from Glassnode Studio My pessimism regarding Bitcoin specifically has been detailed in previous articles. And the way I see it, data continues to show that the increasing prices of the cryptocurrency are occurring with lower and lower volume. In the chart above, you can see the dollar volume and the unit volume of Bitcoin over the last several years now. And in the chart below, you can see a smaller section of time from that chart covering from January of 2024 through June of 2025. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio What this data shows is that, while there have been periodic spikes in activity, the overall trend has been lower, especially over the last several months. In fact, the volume of Bitcoin transactions as measured by total units has hit its lowest level since at least September of 2020. Of course, one could argue that because prices are rising, the number of units transacted should be decreasing. But even the dollar volume of transactions is on the decline. In June of this year, the dollar volume hit $22.28 billion. You would have to go back to September of last year to find volume that was lower than this. And prior to that, you would have to go all the way back to November of 2023. Simply put, this means that prices are being propped up by ever-lower trading activity. Those who are bullish about Bitcoin could very well argue that this is because there has been a shift away from trading it for speculative purposes and toward holding it for investment purposes. There is certainly some evidence to support this view. In this space, there's something referred to as HODL, which is used to refer to those who are holding onto Bitcoin for long-term purposes. The 1-Year HODL Wave specifically refers to the percentage of Bitcoin holders, as measured by addresses or wallets, that have held their Bitcoin for at least one year without conducting any outgoing transactions. Author - Data from Bitbo The rationale here is that, if you are holding for the long term, you are treating this as a legitimate asset as opposed to something that is speculative. In the chart above, you can see the overall trend that we have seen since January of 2017; and in the chart below, you can see the data with Bitcoin prices shown on a logarithmic scale, which is what you should really focus on. Typically, as HODL decreases, Bitcoin prices rise because it means that there is additional transaction activity that, when combined with generally low volumes, pushes prices higher. Generally, it is counterintuitive that increased selling from long-term holders would cause price increases. You would typically expect the price to decline. But there are a couple of reasons why this is. Even though long-term holders are taking a profit or losing confidence in the cryptocurrency, this actually serves as a lagging indicator that drops only after coins move. The higher prices that market participants are willing to pay for Bitcoin, especially as new money from new buyers (such as from ETFs and institutions) comes in and causes a rise in demand, is really nothing more than a reflection of the hype of newcomers. Author - Data from Bitbo There are other reasons why Bitcoin prices seem to be rising. One of these relates to the fact that market participants are increasingly relying on derivatives in order to ramp up returns. According to one source , open interest for Bitcoin futures is around $42 billion today. That's down just slightly from $43 billion previously. Funding rates are also on the rise, which means that there is optimism centered around the idea of prices moving higher since a rise in funding rates means that those who are bullish about Bitcoin are willing to pay to stay with their long positions. Even though funding rates are not as high as they were about a year ago, they are still elevated by historical standards. This could imply overextension, as could be the fact that derivatives activity is at or near all-time highs. Unfortunately, a lot of the metrics relied on by those who are bullish about Bitcoin are double-edged in nature. For instance, the decline in the 1-Year HODL Wave is viewed in a bullish light because it is indicative of price increases. But at the same time, it can also be interpreted as a decline in long-term sentiment. The rise in the futures market can be viewed in a positive light because it indicates increased confidence in Bitcoin. But at the same time, it can be viewed as an overextension caused by over hype. The same can be said of funding rates. Often, what can be perceived as the investment community legitimizing a speculative asset or, in the case of Bitcoin, a faux asset, can really just be evidence that the market is reaching a breaking point. I think those who are bullish about Bitcoin would have a better argument if the number of active addresses were increasing also. But the exact opposite is occurring. Active addresses are unique wallet addresses that are involved in transactions that utilize blockchain technology for a specific window of time. In order for a wallet to be considered to have an active address, it either sends cryptocurrency or receives it during that window of time. So this is a measure of incoming and/or outgoing activity. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio In the table above, you can see monthly data through June of this year regarding active addresses. And in the chart below, you can see trailing 12-month and trailing 5-month average volumes utilizing this data. Overall activity is down. On a trailing 5-month basis, the number of active addresses is down 15.5%. And on a trailing 12-month basis, it's down 23%. This is evidence to me that overall activity in cryptocurrency continues to contract. Derivatives can only push the market so high before prices must rely on underlying fundamentals. And to me, these fundamentals look weak. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio Takeaway I have no idea how high Bitcoin prices will rise. They could grow significantly higher than where they are today. I wouldn't be surprised. At $2.35 trillion for Bitcoin on its own and $3.87 trillion for cryptocurrency in its entirety, the market cap is larger than the GDP of most countries. And all of this is for lines of code that have no intrinsic value. I believe that what many market participants are viewing as evidence of a bullish situation can be interpreted equally as evidence of a bubble that will inevitably hit a breaking point. I would probably feel differently if the overall adoption of Bitcoin as a mechanism of exchange was rising. But with overall activity declining and the market relying heavily on lower volumes and derivatives markets in order to inflate, I fear an inevitable plunge. Because of this, I remain incredibly bearish and will retain the ‚Äòstrong sell‚Äô rating I have on it.

title: Crypto finance company Matrixport Reveals Key Factor Supporting Bitcoin Bull Scenario! Here Are the Details
body: Crypto finance company Matrixport, in its ‚ÄúChart of the Day‚Äù report, emphasized that one of the key factors supporting the Bitcoin (BTC) bull scenario for 2025 is the initial public offering (IPO) preparations of crypto companies. Matrixport: Bitcoin's 2025 Bull Run Could Be Fueled by IPO Wave According to the report, Wall Street investment banks also want to create a favorable market environment for these IPOs by encouraging BTC prices to remain high. This expectation is no longer just a theory. Numerous crypto companies, including Circle, have filed for IPOs. Matrixport reports that a new crypto company is queuing up for IPO almost every week. This is increasing institutional interest and capital flow into the sector. Sharp Rises in Crypto Stocks The stock performance of crypto-focused companies listed on the stock exchange also supports this interest: MicroStrategy: 47% increase Coinbase: 67% increase Robinhood: 180% increase Circle: A stunning 597% rise These massive price increases reinforce investor confidence and increase IPO excitement and participation in the crypto sector. According to Matrixport, the IPO cycle by crypto firms could prolong the bull market by supporting Bitcoin prices to remain high. The interest in this wave from both traditional financial players and individual investors could keep BTC strong through 2025. *This is not investment advice. title: MBG Token Set to Launch on Gate.io and MEXC Following Pre-Sale Success
body: MultiBank Group has announced that its $MBG token will be officially listed on both Gate.io and MEXC on July 22, the same day as the project's Token Generation Event (TGE). The token will also be available for trading on MultiBank.io and Uniswap, offering users both centralized and decentralized access from day one. The dual listing comes on the heels of a successful two-round pre-sale in which the Group sold a total of 10 million tokens at $0.35 each, raising a total of $3.5 million. The sale attracted significant attention across both retail and institutional circles, reflecting the market‚Äôs growing interest in utility tokens connected to real-world asset (RWA) strategies. MBG is positioned as a utility token within MultiBank‚Äôs broader Web3 ecosystem. It will be used for trading fee discounts, staking, loyalty tiers, and early access to platform features. A key component of its roadmap involves supporting RWA tokenization, starting with a $3 billion luxury real estate initiative in Dubai in collaboration with MAG and Mavryk. Naser Taher, Chairman and Founder of MultiBank Group said, ‚ÄúWith $MBG, we‚Äôre introducing a utility token built to deliver real-world value, transparency, and long-term trust. This is a major step in our mission to merge traditional finance with blockchain on a global scale‚Äù. MultiBank brings regulatory legitimacy to the launch, operating in over 17 jurisdictions and managing more than $29 billion in assets. This gives MBG an unusual level of credibility in a token space often characterized by anonymous teams and speculative roadmaps. To support long-term token value, the Group has committed to a $440 million buyback-and-burn program. Revenue from trading operations will be used to reduce the circulating supply of MBG over time, a deflationary strategy designed to align token incentives with actual usage. Listing on exchanges like Gate.io and MEXC expands MBG‚Äôs global accessibility. Gate.io‚Äôs regulatory presence in Europe and MEXC‚Äôs broad reach across Asia and Latin America ensure that the token is immediately tradable across diverse markets. Soon after the TGE, MultiBank will begin rolling out utility integrations. These include staking pools, loyalty rewards, and access to early-stage trading opportunities. The MBG ecosystem will also be supported by a hybrid crypto-tradfi exchange platform, known as MultiBank Exchange (MEX), that is currently under development. Designed to connect Institutional clients with TradFi and digital assets , MEX aims to offer an integrated trading environment once launched. As interest in RWA tokenization continues to grow, MBG‚Äôs listing strategy appears aimed at positioning the token as more than a one-off event. By focusing on exchange accessibility, platform integration, and real-world backing, the Group is making a case for MBG as a durable part of the evolving Web3 financial stack. Additional details regarding cross-chain functionality, staking timelines, and upcoming RWA partnerships are expected to be announced in the coming weeks. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: EU Gaming Company Fragbite Group Launches Bitcoin Treasury with 4.3 BTC Purchase
body: Swedish gaming company Fragbite Group has launched a Bitcoin treasury strategy by purchasing 4.3 Bitcoin at an average price of $112,958 per coin, becoming the latest European firm to adopt cryptocurrency as a primary reserve asset amid a global wave of corporate adoption. The company raised an additional 6 million Swedish krona ($630,000) through an interest-free convertible loan to fund further Bitcoin purchases, with conversion rights triggered if shares exceed the SEK 13 conversion price by 30% for 20 consecutive trading days. Bitcoin Treasury Director Patrik von Bahr called the move positioning Fragbite as ‚Äú an early pioneer in a revolutionary industry .‚Äù First purchase complete 4.3 bitcoin at an average price of app. USD 112 958 / bitcoin marks the start of operations under the newly established Bitcoin Treasury https://t.co/bwPYv8e2SD $FRAG pic.twitter.com/o2vbP95vAK ‚Äî Fragbite Group (@FragbiteGroup) July 22, 2025 The acquisition occurs as corporate Bitcoin adoption accelerates globally, with over 274 companies now holding 3.57M Bitcoin on their balance sheets. Most recently, MicroStrategy added 6,220 Bitcoin for $739.8 million during the week ending July 20, bringing total holdings to 607,770 Bitcoin worth over $43 billion. The corporate treasury trend spans multiple sectors and geographies, with Japanese Metaplanet targeting 210,000 Bitcoin by 2027, London-listed companies announcing nine Bitcoin treasury plans in recent weeks , and European firms increasingly viewing cryptocurrency as an inflation hedge and a strategic asset. European Corporate Bitcoin Adoption Gains Momentum Fragbite Group joins a growing number of European companies embracing Bitcoin treasury strategies as regulatory clarity improves across the region. The gaming firm‚Äôs convertible loan structure offers flexibility, with no interest accruing until November 30, 2030, and includes forced conversion rights if the shares exceed 200% of the conversion price. Similarly, Swedish firm Refine Group also recently launched a $1 million Bitcoin treasury backed by fresh capital. In comparison, London markets have seen companies like Smarter Web Company surge from ¬£4 million to over ¬£1 billion market value following Bitcoin purchase announcements. The European adoption wave contrasts with established corporate treasury leaders, such as MicroStrategy, which continues to accumulate aggressively through at-the-market equity offerings. The company raised $740.3 million across four ATM programs to fund its latest purchase of 6,220 Bitcoins at an average price of $118,940. Moreover, Australian DigitalX secured $13.54 million from Animoca Brands , UTXO Management, and ParaFi Capital for expanding its Bitcoin treasury, bringing its total assets to $95 million. Market Dynamics Signal Rotation as ETF Flows Diverge Institutions are increasingly flocking to Bitcoin as a treasury, as evidenced by Bitcoin spot ETFs, which recorded their first net outflow in 12 days , with $131.35 million exiting on July 21. Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a $131.35M outflow on July 21, snapping a 12-day inflow streak, while Ethereum ETFs pulled in $297M as investor focus shifted. #SpotBitcoinETF #CryptoETF https://t.co/13rOyhITvN ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 22, 2025 This came after over two consecutive weeks of inflows, marking the end of a robust period that had attracted over $6.6 billion since early July. The natural outflow can be primarily attributed to Bitcoin experiencing a slight pullback after its recent $123K ATH peak. BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT reported zero net inflow despite holding $86.16 billion in assets, while Ark Invest‚Äôs ARKB and Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC saw outflows of $77.46 million and $36.75 million, respectively. However, Ethereum ETFs continued their momentum with $296.59 million in daily inflows, extending their winning streak to 12 consecutive days. BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA led with $101.98 million in new capital, while Fidelity‚Äôs FETH attracted $126.93 million, as combined Ethereum ETF assets reached $19.6 billion. Notably, SpaceX has recently sparked concern with its $152.85 million Bitcoin transaction after a three-year hiatus. The movement, as speculated, represents potential portfolio restructuring rather than liquidation. The aerospace company‚Äôs wallet transferred 1,308.45 Bitcoin, while maintaining 6,977 Bitcoin under Coinbase Prime custody, worth approximately $818.3 million. Historical data shows SpaceX received multiple Bitcoin inflows between 2021 and 2022, with holdings exceeding $1.6 billion during the previous bull run. Source: TradingView At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading above $118,700 after consolidating from its all-time high of $123,000.The cryptocurrency is displaying bullish pennant patterns that typically signal continuation moves after a rally correction or pullback. title: Bitcoin Takes Center Stage: Kitabo Unveils Bold $5.4M Treasury Strategy
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Takes Center Stage: Kitabo Unveils Bold $5.4M Treasury Strategy In a move that‚Äôs turning heads across both the traditional financial sector and the burgeoning cryptocurrency world, Kitabo Co., a venerable Japanese textile materials company, has announced its intention to purchase a substantial ¬•800 million (approximately $5.4 million) worth of Bitcoin . This isn‚Äôt just another transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic pivot, signaling a bold new direction for a company rooted in a centuries-old industry. Imagine a textile firm, known for its threads and fabrics, deciding to weave Bitcoin into the very fabric of its financial future. It‚Äôs a fascinating development that underscores the evolving perception of digital assets. What‚Äôs Driving This Bold Bitcoin Move by Kitabo? The announcement, initially shared by @btcNLNico on X, quickly sent ripples through the financial community. Kitabo Co., with its long-standing history in the Japanese textile sector, is stepping into the digital age in a significant way. Their decision to allocate a considerable portion of their treasury to Bitcoin isn‚Äôt arbitrary; it‚Äôs a calculated move rooted in a changing global economic landscape. Traditionally, corporate treasuries hold cash, short-term bonds, or other low-risk liquid assets. However, in an era marked by persistent inflation concerns, currency debasement, and ultra-low interest rates in many developed economies, these traditional assets often yield negative real returns. This erodes purchasing power over time. Companies are increasingly seeking alternative assets that can act as a hedge against inflation and offer potential for capital appreciation. For Kitabo, the decision to invest in Bitcoin likely stems from a multi-faceted analysis: Diversification: Spreading risk beyond traditional financial instruments. Inflation Hedge: Viewing Bitcoin as ‚Äòdigital gold‚Äô capable of preserving value against rising costs. Long-Term Growth Potential: Betting on Bitcoin‚Äôs continued adoption and price appreciation as a nascent asset class. Innovation & Forward-Thinking: Positioning the company as modern and adaptable to new financial paradigms. This isn‚Äôt just about holding a digital asset; it‚Äôs about a company, from a traditional industry, acknowledging the shifting tides of global finance and proactively positioning itself for future economic realities. Why Are Companies Embracing Bitcoin for Their Balance Sheets? Kitabo is certainly making headlines, but they are not the first. The trend of corporations adding Bitcoin to their balance sheets has been gaining momentum over the past few years, pioneered by companies like MicroStrategy and, famously for a period, Tesla. What makes Bitcoin an attractive, albeit unconventional, treasury asset for these diverse enterprises? Here are some compelling reasons that drive corporate Bitcoin adoption: A Hedge Against Inflation: With central banks globally engaging in quantitative easing and governments increasing spending, many fear a devaluation of fiat currencies. Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply cap of 21 million coins makes it inherently scarce, leading many to view it as a superior store of value compared to traditional currencies. Companies see it as a way to protect their capital from erosion. Digital Gold Narrative: Often dubbed ‚Äòdigital gold,‚Äô Bitcoin shares characteristics with the precious metal, such as scarcity and global acceptance. In times of economic uncertainty or geopolitical instability, investors and now corporations, look for safe-haven assets outside the traditional financial system. Diversification of Treasury Assets: Relying solely on cash or low-yielding bonds can be risky in a volatile economic climate. Adding Bitcoin introduces a new asset class with a low correlation to traditional markets, potentially reducing overall portfolio risk and enhancing returns. Potential for Significant Appreciation: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has demonstrated remarkable long-term growth. Companies are willing to take on some short-term price fluctuations for the potential of substantial long-term gains, which could significantly boost their financial reserves. Attracting Talent and Investors: Being an early adopter or an innovative player in the crypto space can enhance a company‚Äôs brand image. It can signal to tech-savvy talent and investors that the company is forward-thinking and adaptable, potentially attracting new capital and human resources. Future-Proofing Business Models: As the world becomes increasingly digital, integrating cryptocurrencies might be seen as a necessary step for future business operations, whether for payments, supply chain management, or other blockchain-enabled functionalities. These factors collectively paint a picture of why companies, from software firms to textile manufacturers, are re-evaluating their treasury strategies and considering Bitcoin as a legitimate, if unconventional, asset. Navigating the Challenges: What Risks Does Holding Bitcoin Present? While the potential benefits of holding Bitcoin are appealing, it‚Äôs crucial to acknowledge the inherent risks. Kitabo, or any company considering such a move, must perform rigorous due diligence to mitigate these challenges: Price Volatility: Bitcoin is notorious for its rapid and often unpredictable price swings. A sudden downturn could significantly impact a company‚Äôs balance sheet, leading to substantial paper losses. This volatility can be a major concern for financial reporting and investor relations. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Laws regarding ownership, taxation, and trading of digital assets vary widely by jurisdiction and can change rapidly, posing compliance risks and potential legal challenges. Security Risks: Holding large amounts of Bitcoin requires robust security measures to protect against hacking, theft, and loss of private keys. Companies must invest in secure custody solutions, whether self-custody with stringent internal controls or third-party institutional custodians. Accounting Treatment: How Bitcoin is accounted for on a company‚Äôs financial statements can be complex. In many jurisdictions, it‚Äôs treated as an intangible asset, meaning impairment losses must be recognized if its value drops below the purchase price, while gains are only recognized upon sale. This can lead to non-cash losses impacting profitability. Environmental Concerns: The energy consumption associated with Bitcoin mining has raised environmental concerns. While the industry is moving towards more sustainable practices, companies might face scrutiny from ESG-focused investors or stakeholders. A well-thought-out strategy, often involving a phased approach and expert consultation, is essential to navigate these complexities effectively. Is Kitabo‚Äôs Bitcoin Purchase a Sign of a Wider Trend in Japan? Japan has a unique relationship with cryptocurrencies. It was one of the first countries to regulate digital assets, famously recognizing Bitcoin as legal property in 2017. However, the market has also seen its share of challenges, including the infamous Mt. Gox hack. Despite this, Japan remains a significant player in the crypto space, with a robust regulatory framework overseen by the Financial Services Agency (FSA). Kitabo‚Äôs move could be a bellwether for other Japanese corporations. Japanese companies are often characterized by their cautious and consensus-driven decision-making. If a traditional company like Kitabo is making such a significant leap, it suggests a growing acceptance and understanding of Bitcoin‚Äôs potential within the Japanese corporate sphere. This could inspire other firms, particularly those facing similar economic pressures or looking to enhance their global competitiveness, to explore similar treasury strategies. The cultural emphasis on long-term planning and stability in Japan might also play a role. If Bitcoin is increasingly viewed as a long-term store of value rather than a speculative asset, more companies might consider it. This development from Kitabo adds another layer to the narrative of institutional adoption of Bitcoin , specifically within a market known for its prudence. Actionable Insights for Businesses Considering Bitcoin Adoption For any business contemplating following Kitabo‚Äôs lead and integrating Bitcoin into its treasury, a structured and cautious approach is paramount. This isn‚Äôt a decision to be taken lightly or without thorough preparation. Here are some actionable insights: Conduct Thorough Due Diligence: Before any investment, deeply understand Bitcoin‚Äôs technology, market dynamics, and historical performance. Assess its correlation with your existing assets and its potential impact on your financial statements. Define Your Strategy and Risk Tolerance: Clearly articulate why you are investing in Bitcoin (e.g., inflation hedge, growth asset) and what percentage of your treasury you are willing to allocate. Establish clear risk parameters and exit strategies. Consult Experts: Engage with legal, financial, tax, and cybersecurity professionals who specialize in cryptocurrencies. Their expertise is invaluable in navigating the complex regulatory landscape, optimizing tax implications, and ensuring robust security protocols. Prioritize Security and Custody: This is non-negotiable. Research and implement institutional-grade custody solutions. Options range from self-custody with multi-signature wallets to reputable third-party custodians with strong insurance policies and audit trails. Develop Robust Internal Controls: Establish clear policies and procedures for the acquisition, management, and eventual disposition of Bitcoin . This includes access controls, transaction approval processes, and regular audits. Stay Informed on Regulatory Developments: The crypto regulatory environment is dynamic. Assign a team or individual to continuously monitor changes in laws and accounting standards that could impact your holdings. Consider a Phased Approach: Instead of a large, single purchase, consider dollar-cost averaging or making smaller, incremental investments over time to mitigate volatility risks and refine your strategy. Kitabo‚Äôs move is a testament to the growing legitimacy of Bitcoin as a treasury asset. However, successful adoption hinges on meticulous planning and a deep understanding of both its potential and its challenges. The Pioneering Path Forward for Bitcoin Kitabo‚Äôs decision to integrate Bitcoin into its treasury strategy marks a significant moment, not just for the company, but for the broader narrative of institutional cryptocurrency adoption. It‚Äôs a powerful testament to the evolving perception of Bitcoin ‚Äì from a niche digital curiosity to a recognized, albeit volatile, asset class with a legitimate place in corporate finance. This move by a traditional Japanese textile firm underscores a growing global trend: companies are actively seeking innovative ways to protect and grow their capital in an uncertain economic climate. As more entities, particularly those outside the tech sphere, embrace Bitcoin , its journey towards mainstream acceptance continues to accelerate. Kitabo‚Äôs bold step could indeed be a pioneering signal for a new wave of corporate treasury diversification, solidifying Bitcoin‚Äôs position as a transformative force in the global financial landscape. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: Why would a traditional textile company like Kitabo buy Bitcoin ? Kitabo‚Äôs decision to buy Bitcoin is likely part of a modern treasury strategy aimed at diversifying assets, hedging against inflation, and potentially capitalizing on Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term growth. Traditional assets like cash and low-yielding bonds are less attractive in an environment of inflation and low interest rates, prompting companies to explore alternative stores of value. Q2: What are the main risks for companies holding Bitcoin as a treasury asset? The primary risks include significant price volatility, which can impact financial statements; regulatory uncertainty due to the evolving legal landscape; and security concerns, as large holdings require robust protection against theft or loss. Accounting treatment, which often recognizes impairment losses but only gains upon sale, can also be a challenge. Q3: Is Kitabo‚Äôs Bitcoin purchase part of a wider trend among Japanese companies? While Japan has a regulated crypto market, Kitabo‚Äôs move is a notable step for a traditional Japanese firm. It could signal a growing acceptance of Bitcoin as a legitimate asset class within the cautious Japanese corporate culture, potentially inspiring other companies to explore similar strategies, especially given global economic pressures. Q4: How does this institutional adoption impact Bitcoin‚Äôs market perception? Each instance of institutional adoption, like Kitabo‚Äôs, enhances Bitcoin‚Äôs legitimacy and maturity as an asset. It shifts its perception from a purely speculative instrument to a more credible and viable component of corporate financial strategy, which can attract more mainstream investors and further stabilize the market over time. Q5: What is EEAT in the context of content creation? EEAT stands for Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness. It‚Äôs a set of guidelines from Google that helps assess the quality of content, particularly for topics that can impact users‚Äô health, finances, or safety. For this article, it means providing accurate, well-researched information from a knowledgeable perspective, offering a balanced view, and building reader trust. Did you find Kitabo‚Äôs bold move as fascinating as we did? Share your thoughts on this pioneering step and what it means for the future of corporate treasury strategies on your social media! Let‚Äôs get the conversation going. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin‚Äôs institutional adoption. This post Bitcoin Takes Center Stage: Kitabo Unveils Bold $5.4M Treasury Strategy first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: India‚Äôs Crypto Tax Trouble Leads to Calls for Cuts and Clear Rules
body: The post India‚Äôs Crypto Tax Trouble Leads to Calls for Cuts and Clear Rules appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News India‚Äôs crypto users continue to struggle with the high taxes and a lack of clear regulations. Former MP Ritesh Panday has once again stood up for India‚Äôs crypto community and is urging the government to cut 30% tax, remove the 1% TDS and bring in clear regulations. Over-Regulation Could Kill India‚Äôs Web3 Potential He explained how buying an NFT involves three steps, buying crypto, transferring it to a wallet, and making the purchase, With the current rules, 1% TDS is charged at every stage. He warned that this kind of policy creates red tape, stifles innovation, and could kill a growing, youth-driven industry. Former MP Ritesh Pandey raises his voice again for Indian crypto users: ‚Ä¢ Cut 30% crypto tax ‚Ä¢ Remove 1% TDS ‚Ä¢ Bring clear, fair regulations He calls crypto a ‚Äúyuva asset class‚Äù ‚Äî built for India‚Äôs young innovators. pic.twitter.com/CqUfwSmgsY ‚Äî Sujal Jethwani (@SujalJethwani) July 22, 2025 India has the potential to lead in Web 3.0 with its many startups and unicorns. But such heavy-handed regulation is choking innovation before it has a chance to grow. India‚Äôs Crypto Tax Burden Keeps Growing India doesn‚Äôt yet have a law to regulate crypto, but strict taxes are already in place. Indian crypto users face a steep tax burden. There is a¬†30% tax on any profits they make from crypto trades. Then, a 1% TDS is taken on every sell transaction, no matter the amount. Starting July 7, 2025, things got even tougher. Bybit will start charging 18% GST on almost all crypto services, like trading, staking, withdrawals, deposits, token swaps, and more. Heavy Taxes Driving $42B in Volume Offshore Sumit Gupta, the CEO of CoinDCX has pointed out that the 1% TDS rule is doing more harm than good. He revealed that it has driven over 5 million Indian users to offshore platforms, shifting $42 billion in trading volume abroad between July 2022 and July 2023. As a result, the government lost an estimated $4.2 billion in revenue, while collecting only $31 million via TDS. Many Indians are using foreign crypto platforms to trade. Indians traded Rs 2.63 lakh crore on them in just 10 months, skipping around Rs 2,600 crore in taxes. If this continues, losses could cross Rs 17,000 crore soon. Lack of Regulation, Weak Tracking, and Rising Security Concerns Crypto is still unregulated in India. Platforms should register under anti-money laundering laws, but many fail to comply. Besides,major security breaches at exchanges like CoinDCX and WazirX have raised serious concerns about the safety of user assets. Besdies, india does not have a real-time system to track if people are honestly reporting their crypto income. Since crypto tax rules kicked in (FY 2022‚Äì23), the Government has collected over Rs 700 crore, but they haven‚Äôt estimated how much money might be lost due to under-reporting. Tax officers are getting trained blockchain, digital forensics, and related areas. But experts doubt if this training is enough to keep up with the fast-moving crypto world. COINS Act 2025: A Bold Blueprint But efforts are underway. Hashed Emergent recently introduced the COINS Act 2025, a bold, rights-based crypto proposal. It calls for self-custody rights, tax reforms, a dedicated regulator. Although it not a law yet, but its a powerful blueprint to make India a true Web3 leader.

title: BNB Holdings Soar: Nano Labs‚Äô Astounding $90M Strategic Boost in Web 3.0
body: BitcoinWorld BNB Holdings Soar: Nano Labs‚Äô Astounding $90M Strategic Boost in Web 3.0 The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with significant developments, and a recent announcement from Nasdaq-listed Web 3.0 infrastructure provider, Nano Labs Ltd, has certainly captured attention. In a bold move that underscores growing institutional confidence in digital assets, Nano Labs has substantially increased its BNB holdings , transforming its strategic reserve with a massive injection of capital. What‚Äôs Behind Nano Labs‚Äô Astounding Increase in BNB Holdings ? Nano Labs Ltd, a prominent player in the Web 3.0 space, recently made waves with its announcement via a Globe Newswire press release: the company has boosted its BNB holdings to an impressive 120,000 tokens. This significant accumulation, valued at approximately $90 million, is not merely a speculative investment but a calculated component of its long-term strategic reserve plan. But what exactly does this entail for a company operating at the forefront of Web 3.0 innovation? This strategic move by Nano Labs reflects a growing trend among tech-forward companies to diversify their treasury assets beyond traditional fiat currencies. For Nano Labs, integrating a substantial amount of BNB into its reserves could serve multiple purposes: Balance Sheet Strength: Holding a liquid and widely recognized digital asset like BNB can enhance the company‚Äôs financial stability and liquidity, especially within the volatile yet opportunity-rich crypto ecosystem. Ecosystem Alignment: BNB is the native cryptocurrency of the Binance ecosystem, which includes the Binance Smart Chain (BSC), a vital platform for many Web 3.0 applications. Increasing BNB holdings might signal a deeper alignment or future integration with this expansive ecosystem. Strategic Flexibility: A substantial BNB reserve provides Nano Labs with greater flexibility for future investments, partnerships, or even operational expenses within the decentralized finance (DeFi) and Web 3.0 sectors. Inflation Hedge: In an era of economic uncertainty and rising inflation, digital assets are increasingly viewed as potential hedges against the devaluation of fiat currencies, offering a different kind of stability. This decision is a testament to Nano Labs‚Äô forward-thinking approach, positioning itself not just as a builder of Web 3.0 infrastructure but also as a significant participant in its underlying economy. Understanding the Power of BNB Holdings in the Web 3.0 Landscape To fully grasp the magnitude of Nano Labs‚Äô decision, it‚Äôs essential to understand BNB itself. BNB, originally launched as Binance Coin, is far more than just a cryptocurrency; it‚Äôs the foundational token of the Binance ecosystem, one of the largest and most influential in the blockchain world. Its utility extends across various facets, including: Transaction Fees: Used to pay for transaction fees on Binance Chain and Binance Smart Chain. Staking and Governance: Holders can stake BNB to secure the network and participate in governance decisions. Discounts: Offers discounts on trading fees on the Binance exchange. Launchpad Access: Provides access to token sales on the Binance Launchpad, a platform for new crypto projects. Ecosystem Growth: Fuels a vast array of decentralized applications (dApps), DeFi protocols, and NFTs built on the Binance Smart Chain. Nano Labs‚Äô significant accumulation of BNB isn‚Äôt just about holding a digital asset; it‚Äôs about embedding themselves deeper into an ecosystem that is central to the very infrastructure they are building. Their increased BNB holdings can be seen as a strategic bet on the continued growth and dominance of the Binance ecosystem within the broader Web 3.0 paradigm. What Are the Potential Benefits for Nano Labs and the Market from These Elevated BNB Holdings ? The implications of Nano Labs‚Äô move extend beyond its balance sheet, potentially sending positive signals throughout the cryptocurrency market and, specifically, the Web 3.0 sector. Let‚Äôs explore some key benefits: For Nano Labs: Enhanced Credibility: As a Nasdaq-listed entity, a public declaration of substantial BNB holdings lends significant credibility to digital assets as legitimate corporate treasury assets. This can inspire confidence among traditional investors who might be hesitant about crypto. Operational Synergies: With significant BNB reserves, Nano Labs might find it easier to engage in partnerships, joint ventures, or even acquisitions within the Binance ecosystem, fostering closer ties and operational efficiencies. Future-Proofing: By aligning with a robust and evolving blockchain ecosystem, Nano Labs is arguably future-proofing its operations and strategic direction in a rapidly digitizing world. For the Market and BNB: Increased Demand and Stability: A large-scale institutional purchase like this directly contributes to BNB‚Äôs demand, potentially influencing its price stability and overall market capitalization. Validation of Web 3.0 Assets: It serves as a powerful validation of Web 3.0 infrastructure tokens as viable long-term investments for established companies, encouraging others to consider similar strategies. Positive Sentiment: Such news can generate positive sentiment, drawing more attention and investment into the BNB ecosystem and the wider Web 3.0 space. This strategic move highlights a maturing cryptocurrency market where digital assets are no longer just speculative tools but are increasingly integrated into corporate financial strategies. Navigating the Challenges: Risks Associated with Significant BNB Holdings While the strategic benefits are compelling, it‚Äôs crucial to acknowledge the inherent risks associated with holding a large portfolio of any cryptocurrency, including BNB. The digital asset market is renowned for its volatility, and this can present several challenges for Nano Labs: Market Volatility: The value of BNB holdings can fluctuate wildly, leading to significant unrealized gains or losses on the company‚Äôs balance sheet. This volatility can impact investor perception and financial reporting. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving globally. Changes in regulations regarding digital assets could impact the value or usability of BNB, affecting Nano Labs‚Äô strategic reserves. Security Risks: While robust, digital assets are susceptible to cyberattacks, hacks, or mismanagement if not stored with the highest security protocols. Protecting $90 million in BNB requires sophisticated security infrastructure. Liquidity Concerns: Although BNB is highly liquid, a sudden need to liquidate a large portion of their BNB holdings could potentially impact market prices, especially during periods of low trading volume. Nano Labs, as a Nasdaq-listed company, will undoubtedly have robust risk management frameworks in place to mitigate these challenges. Their decision to increase BNB holdings suggests a careful assessment of these risks against the perceived long-term advantages within the Web 3.0 economy. What Does This Mean for the Future of Corporate Crypto Adoption and BNB Holdings ? Nano Labs‚Äô bold step is part of a larger narrative unfolding in the corporate world: the increasing acceptance and integration of cryptocurrencies into treasury management. While Bitcoin has often been the pioneer in this regard, companies are now looking at a broader range of digital assets that align with their specific business models and ecosystem interests. This trend is driven by several factors: Technological Advancement: Web 3.0 technologies are maturing, offering more stable and utility-driven assets. Institutional Infrastructure: Better custody solutions, trading platforms, and financial products are making it safer and easier for corporations to engage with crypto. Long-Term Vision: Companies are recognizing the potential of blockchain and digital assets to revolutionize various industries, prompting them to invest strategically. The move by Nano Labs to bolster its BNB holdings could inspire other Web 3.0 companies, and even traditional tech firms, to explore similar strategies. It signals a growing confidence in specific altcoins that have strong ecosystems and clear utility, moving beyond just Bitcoin and Ethereum as primary corporate crypto assets. It also underscores the idea that corporate crypto adoption is not a monolithic phenomenon. Instead, it‚Äôs a nuanced process where companies select assets that best serve their strategic goals, whether it‚Äôs for balance sheet diversification, operational utility, or ecosystem alignment. Nano Labs‚Äô choice of BNB exemplifies this tailored approach. A Look at Corporate Crypto Treasury Trends To put Nano Labs‚Äô move into perspective, consider the evolving landscape of corporate crypto treasuries. While not an exhaustive list, here‚Äôs a glimpse at how some companies have approached digital asset integration: Company Primary Crypto Holding Motivation MicroStrategy Bitcoin Inflation hedge, primary treasury asset Tesla Bitcoin Balance sheet diversification, payment acceptance (historically) Square (Block Inc.) Bitcoin Investment, support for crypto innovation Nano Labs BNB Strategic reserve, Web 3.0 ecosystem alignment This table illustrates that while Bitcoin remains popular, the decision by Nano Labs to significantly increase its BNB holdings marks a notable diversification in corporate crypto strategy, emphasizing utility and ecosystem integration over pure store-of-value plays. Summary: Nano Labs‚Äô Bold Stance with Amplified BNB Holdings Nano Labs Ltd‚Äôs decision to increase its BNB holdings to a substantial $90 million is a powerful statement in the evolving digital economy. It highlights a growing trend of Nasdaq-listed companies integrating significant cryptocurrency assets into their strategic reserves, moving beyond traditional financial instruments. This move is not just about financial diversification; it‚Äôs a strategic alignment with the Binance ecosystem, a core pillar of the Web 3.0 infrastructure that Nano Labs is actively building. While challenges like market volatility and regulatory shifts remain, the benefits of enhanced liquidity, ecosystem synergies, and long-term positioning appear to outweigh the risks for the forward-thinking Web 3.0 provider. As the lines between traditional finance and the decentralized world continue to blur, Nano Labs‚Äô substantial BNB holdings serve as a compelling example of how established companies are embracing digital assets to navigate and thrive in the future of technology and finance. This bold investment signals a deep conviction in the utility and longevity of specific digital assets within their operational landscape. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is Nano Labs Ltd? Nano Labs Ltd is a Nasdaq-listed Web 3.0 infrastructure provider. They focus on building foundational technologies and services for the decentralized internet, including high-performance computing and blockchain solutions. Q2: Why did Nano Labs increase its BNB holdings ? Nano Labs increased its BNB holdings as part of a strategic reserve plan. This move aims to strengthen its balance sheet, align more closely with the Binance ecosystem (crucial for Web 3.0), gain strategic flexibility for future investments, and potentially act as an inflation hedge. Q3: What are the potential risks for Nano Labs holding such large BNB holdings ? The primary risks include market volatility, which can lead to significant fluctuations in the value of their holdings; regulatory uncertainty in the crypto space; security risks associated with digital asset custody; and potential liquidity concerns if a large amount needs to be sold quickly. Q4: How does Nano Labs‚Äô decision impact the broader Web 3.0 ecosystem? This decision validates Web 3.0 infrastructure tokens as viable long-term corporate investments, potentially encouraging other companies to adopt similar strategies. It also contributes to BNB‚Äôs demand and stability, fostering positive sentiment within the Binance ecosystem and the wider Web 3.0 space. Q5: Is it common for Nasdaq-listed companies to hold significant cryptocurrency reserves? While not yet mainstream, it‚Äôs an emerging trend. Companies like MicroStrategy and Tesla have notably held Bitcoin. Nano Labs‚Äô decision to hold a substantial amount of BNB, an altcoin with strong ecosystem utility, marks a significant and more diversified approach to corporate crypto treasury management. Q6: What is the significance of BNB within the Binance ecosystem? BNB is the native token of the Binance ecosystem, offering utility for transaction fees on Binance Chain and Smart Chain, staking, governance participation, trading fee discounts on the Binance exchange, and access to new projects via Binance Launchpad. It fuels a vast network of dApps and DeFi protocols. If you found this article insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Help us spread awareness about the evolving landscape of corporate crypto adoption and the exciting developments in the Web 3.0 space. title: Bitcoin Price Faces Critical Support: Can It Rise To $130K?
body: The post Bitcoin Price Faces Critical Support: Can It Rise To $130K? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News After surging to a new all-time high of $123,231 on July 14th, the Bitcoin price has started to cool down due to exhaustion in strength. As of writing, it is consolidating around the $116,000 to $120,000 range, which has turned down to a zone that has become a battleground for short-term sentiment. Meanwhile, when writing, the bulls in intraday have pushed BTC 1.34% to trade at $119,018 with $74.46 billion 24-hour volume and $2.37 trillion market cap. Now, traders and analysts are intrigued by BTC‚Äôs next move and are watching closely to find out whether this is a healthy retest or the beginning of a deeper correction. Rising Exchange Reserves Hint at Selling Pressure A primary concern right now is the increase in Bitcoin exchange reserves , which have risen to their highest point since late June. Per CryptoQuant insights , this uptick often signals that traders are moving coins onto exchanges to sell. This signifies a short-term profit-taking phase. However, the data isn‚Äôt entirely bearish. Despite growing reserves, overall inflows remain low when compared to peak periods earlier in the year. This implies that although some selling is occurring, it hasn‚Äôt reached levels that typically precede larger market downturns. This clearly suggests that retailers are offloading, and giants are absorbing it. Institutional Flows and Long-Term Holders Stay Committed At the same time, long-term on-chain signals remain constructive with the ETF data mostly green in July, with a cumulative total net inflow of $54.62 billion. Meanwhile, Michael Saylor keeps on accumulating, and other firms are also buying it. These steady inflows highlight sustained interest from large capital allocators, even as retail traders are realizing their gains. Analyst Finds $116K‚Äì$116.4K Zone As Crucial Technically, the Bitcoin price has been mostly trading in a range near $116K to $120K range in the past couple of days, where $116K to $116.4 is seen as critical immediate support, identified by a CryptoQuant analyst. Also, the recent intraday rise in BTC was observed from the same level. If the momentum is building again and manages to flip range high of $120K, then in the short term $125 and $130K would be the near-term targets. But if consolidation in the current range continues, then immediate support needs to hold the momentum for the BTC price. On the other hand, if BTC breaks below $116K with volume, it opens the door for a steeper retracement, potentially to $112K or even $110K. Analysts suggest that the bullish thesis remains valid as long as this $110K level isn‚Äôt breached.

title: OpenAI and Oracle band together for new 4.5GW of AI capacity
body: OpenAI is working with Oracle Corp. to roll out 4.5 gigawatts of new data center power across the U.S., according to Bloomberg. This expansion adds to OpenAI‚Äôs massive AI compute buildout, aiming to push total capacity above 5 gigawatts when you include what they‚Äôre already building in Abilene, Texas. The company said the project will rely on more than 2 million chips to run artificial intelligence tasks across several undisclosed locations still being finalized. They‚Äôre looking at Texas, Michigan, Wisconsin, and Wyoming as possible options. OpenAI hasn‚Äôt revealed exact sites yet, but the deal stacks on top of a previously announced $500 billion commitment it made with Oracle and SoftBank Group Corp. in January. That plan aimed to build 10 gigawatts of AI infrastructure in the U.S. over four years. On Tuesday, OpenAI said it now expects to go past that number. Oracle didn‚Äôt offer a response when asked for comment. OpenAI moves fast with Oracle while SoftBank stalls This new build is being rolled out under OpenAI‚Äôs internal Stargate project, but SoftBank isn‚Äôt part of this round. The AI giant made it clear that SoftBank isn‚Äôt backing this stage of development, even though they were in on the earlier $500 billion announcement. Back in May, Bloomberg reported that SoftBank was running into financing problems tied to wider global economic tension, including concerns around tariffs. As for the existing Stargate facility in Abilene, OpenAI said it‚Äôs already producing compute power. Part of the building is now live and running actual training workloads. Oracle has delivered the first Nvidia GB200 racks, and machines are already up. ‚ÄúWe feel pretty good about our ability to move quickly on this because in many regards, Abilene was that beta test to prove out that you could build these at scale and at speed,‚Äù said Chris Lehane, OpenAI‚Äôs vice president of global policy. Bloomberg also reported earlier this month that OpenAI will rent the new capacity from Oracle rather than build and operate it directly. This means Oracle handles the infrastructure, while Altman‚Äôs firm focuses on the AI. With the additional sites, the company says its total compute operations will run on over 2 million chips, likely using more of the GB200s already being tested in Texas. Another big number: 100,000 jobs. OpenAI said this construction wave will lead to more than one hundred thousand new roles tied to both building and running the data centers. That‚Äôs a surprising change, considering data centers typically don‚Äôt require large numbers of full-time staff once built. This figure suggests a major short-term labor push around planning, construction, power systems, and delivery. D.C. office to open as OpenAI builds political ties Aside from infrastructure, OpenAI is setting up a permanent base in Washington, D.C. The company confirmed it will open its first office in the capital early next year. Right now, about 30 employees work from a co-working space in the city, but that setup is ending. The D.C. office will be used to manage OpenAI‚Äôs interactions with government officials, lawmakers, and federal agencies. CEO Sam Altman is scheduled to speak at a Federal Reserve event in D.C. on Tuesday, highlighting the shift toward federal engagement. This comes just after the company introduced a product called OpenAI for Government in June and disclosed it had received a contract worth up to $200 million from the U.S. Department of Defense. OpenAI said the D.C. location will also house a new lab called The Workshop. This space is designed for nonprofit leaders, educators, and policymakers to get hands-on with its tech. They‚Äôll be able to preview new tools, take part in training, and speak directly with the company‚Äôs team. ‚ÄúThe space will be used to preview new technology, offer trainings and bring together experts,‚Äù a spokesperson said Monday. As of now, OpenAI holds offices in San Francisco, New York, Seattle, London, Paris, Tokyo, and Singapore. The company was valued at $300 billion earlier this year and continues expanding its physical and political presence across the globe. title: Chainlink (LINK) Price Eyes $22 Breakout‚ÄîWill it Hit $28 Before the Next Pullback?
body: The post Chainlink (LINK) Price Eyes $22 Breakout‚ÄîWill it Hit $28 Before the Next Pullback? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Chainlink price has recently reignited bullish sentiment after reclaiming critical support and breaking past the $17.50 resistance. After a strong rebound from the $12.70 support zone, LINK surged above the crucial threshold, signaling a shift in the momentum. With the current trading volume rising and the other technicals that are about to go bullish, the LINK price is about to trigger a strong upswing. The LINK price underwent a notable uptick, a 50% upswing since the start of the month after breaking from the falling wedge. The price continues to rise; although the fear of a correction flashed for a while; the bulls managed to keep up the momentum of the rally. This was due to the immense participation of the investors, which was reflected by the rising active addresses that were jammed around a certain range. The rise in the active address suggests the token is gaining attention from market participants, as the trading activity surged significantly. The rise in the daily active address was complemented by a rise in the price, while the investors seem to be more in accumulation mode rather than distribution. The exchange balances have plunged and reached their lowest levels since inception, indicating the rising optimism among the traders. Now the question arises, what‚Äôs next for the Chainlink price? Will it reach $50 in 2025? The weekly chart of LINK price suggests the token is trading within a bullish pattern and is testing the neckline of the double-bottom pattern. The CMF has surged beyond 0, while the weekly MACD has just turned bullish after remaining bearish since the start of the year. These are the most bullish factors for the Chainlink price rally, which suggests a bullish breakout is imminent, which may push the price to the upper resistance of the rising parallel channel. These levels around $38 could be the final barrier ahead of the current ATH at $53; hence, a breakout above the parallel channel may help the LINK price to enter the discovery phase and form new highs.

title: XRP Breakout Echoes 2020‚ÄîSets Sights on $10 as Market Cap Flips Shell
body: Will XRP‚Äôs $10 Price Target See the Light of Day? According to market analyst Adex crypt, ‚ÄúXRP is mirroring its 2020 price action almost perfectly same structure, same key levels, same breakout setup. If this fractal plays out again, a move to $10 could be in sight.‚Äù Therefore, the analyst believes that if XRP‚Äôs price follows in its 2020 footsteps, then the way for a bold $10 target might come to light. XRP has executed a textbook breakout from a multi‚Äëyear symmetrical triangle, consolidating between $3.40‚Äì$3.60, and now hovering around the psychological price of $3.50. Institutional confidence is visible in both price and volume with whale wallets having accumulated over 2.2 billion XRP, particularly near the $3.34 support zone. Additionally, the ProShares Ultra XRP ETF‚Äôs launch, combined with fresh U.S. crypto legislation, has turbo‚Äëcharged institutional inflows. Therefore, Adex crypt‚Äôs technical study aligns XRP with its 2020 blueprint. The breakout from a long-term base, boosted by institutional accumulation and powerful indicators, supports a modest $5 to $6 target and leaves the $10 objective well within reach if momentum endures. Meanwhile, the analyst had previously noted that XRP had emerged from a seven‚Äëyear double‚Äëbottom or ascending‚Äëtriangle structure and was poised to extend its bull run parabolically after retesting the neckline with eyes on the $5.74 zone. XRP Surpasses Shell in Market Value According to CompaniesMarketCap , XRP is now the world‚Äôs 79th-largest asset with a $206.72B market cap, edging past Shell‚Äôs $206.16B to claim the spot. This milestone of XRP surpassing one of the globe's largest energy conglomerates signals a seismic shift in investor sentiment, regulation, and capital flow toward digital assets. A Symbol of Digital Asset Maturation XRP‚Äôs ascendancy reflects its transformation from a fringe cryptocurrency into a mainstream financial instrument. No longer confined to niche trading circles, XRP now competes directly with blue‚Äëchip companies in terms of market value. Therefore this is a powerful signal that crypto assets have earned their place in institutional portfolios, given that XRP is increasingly being deployed in cross‚Äëborder payment solutions and treasury functions. Changing Investment Narratives For decades, equities like Shell embodied stability and tangible value, such as oil reserves, dividends, and global infrastructure. Now, XRP‚Äôs digital ledger and high‚Äëfrequency payments are offering fast-growth alternatives. Therefore, XRP overtaking Shell in terms of market value signals a shift in narrative where investors are increasingly prioritising innovation, utility, and network effects over bricks-and-mortar assets. Furthermore, it reflects an investment world increasingly open to digital innovation. Conclusion Seeing XRP outshine a global energy giant spotlights the mainstreaming of digital assets. Once confined to speculative trading, cryptocurrencies are now part of institutional portfolios, challenging traditional investments on valuation grounds. Therefore, XRP elbowing Shell reflects the increasing legitimacy of digital assets and a dramatic shift in global finance. Meanwhile, Under Adex‚ÄØcrypt‚Äôs lens, XRP‚Äôs current technical structure echoes its 2020 performance, reinforced by substantial whale buying, supply reduction, and elevated institutional positioning. If these alignments hold, a trajectory toward $10, which is roughly a 2.8√ó move from the current price of $3.5 could emerge within the next 6 to 18 months.

title: Bitcoin ETFs See $131M Outflow After 12-Day Inflow Run
body: ARK Invest‚Äôs ARKB led the withdrawals with $77.46 million, followed by Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC and Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC. Despite the dip, total net assets remain strong at $151.6 billion. Analysts see the move as strategic rebalancing rather than panic selling. Meanwhile, spot Ethereum ETFs continued gaining momentum by bringing in $296.59 million on Monday and extending their inflow streak to 12 days. Profit Taking Hits Bitcoin ETFs Spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) experienced a reversal on Monday after recording a net outflow of $131.35 million and breaking a 12-day streak. The largest withdrawal came from ARK Invest‚Äôs ARKB, which lost $77.46 million in a single day. Bitcoin ETF flow (Source: Farside Investors ) Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC followed with $36.75 million in outflows, while Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC posted a $12.75 million decrease. Bitwise‚Äôs BITB and VanEck‚Äôs HODL also reported modest outflows of $1.91 million and $2.48 million, respectively. BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT, which is the largest spot Bitcoin ETF by net assets at $86.16 billion, remained unchanged with no inflows or outflows. Despite Monday‚Äôs retreat, total cumulative inflows into spot Bitcoin ETFs are still strong at $54.62 billion, with combined net assets now totaling $151.60 billion. This represents 6.52% of Bitcoin‚Äôs overall market capitalization. According to Vincent Liu , chief investment officer at Kronos Research, the recent outflows are not indicative of panic but rather strategic profit-taking by institutions close to Bitcoin‚Äôs all-time highs. Liu explained that this movement was a ‚Äúnatural pause‚Äù after an aggressive rally and should be seen as an institutional rebalancing rather than fear-based selling. The pullback happened on the heels of record-breaking inflows earlier in July where Bitcoin ETFs saw back-to-back billion-dollar days on July 10 and 11. In contrast to Bitcoin‚Äôs brief outflow hiccup, spot Ether ETFs continued their strong upward momentum by bringing in an additional $296.59 million on Monday. Ethereum ETF flow (Source: Farside Investors ) This extended their inflow streak to 12 consecutive days, and raised cumulative net inflows to $7.78 billion. The surge in interest was particularly evident last week when Ethereum ETFs posted their highest single-day inflows since launch, with $726.74 million on Wednesday followed by $602.02 million on Thursday.

title: AI Agents: Mixus Unlocks Seamless Workplace Automation via Email for a Revolutionary Future
body: BitcoinWorld AI Agents: Mixus Unlocks Seamless Workplace Automation via Email for a Revolutionary Future In the fast-evolving world of technology, where decentralization and efficiency are paramount, the promise of AI agents mirrors the disruptive potential we‚Äôve seen in cryptocurrencies. Just as blockchain aims to streamline financial systems, advanced AI is poised to revolutionize our daily workflows. However, while AI companies tout agents as the next major workplace disruptor, their widespread adoption has faced significant hurdles. Imagine an AI that truly understands your needs, collaborates seamlessly, and integrates into your existing tools without a steep learning curve. This is the vision startup Mixus is bringing to life, leveraging an unexpected yet universally familiar tool: email. Why Current AI Agents Fall Short and the Rise of Human-in-the-Loop AI The hype around autonomous AI agents is undeniable, yet many experts agree they aren‚Äôt quite ready for prime time. Current iterations often struggle with truly autonomous decision-making, lack the ability to cooperate effectively with other agents, and frequently fall short on confidentiality awareness. Furthermore, their integration into existing enterprise systems can be clunky, requiring significant developer input or forcing users into new, unfamiliar environments. Industry pioneers like Andrej Karpathy and Ali Ghodsi have consistently emphasized the need for human oversight, a concept known as human-in-the-loop AI . This approach suggests that for AI agents to succeed, humans must remain an integral part of the workflow, guiding and verifying decisions rather than being entirely replaced. Mixus has embraced this philosophy, building an AI agent platform that not only keeps humans central but also allows interaction directly from ubiquitous tools like email and Slack. Mixus‚Äôs Revolutionary Email AI Integration for Effortless Workplace Automation Mixus is fundamentally changing how businesses approach workplace automation by meeting users where they already are: their inbox. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre meeting customers where they are today,‚Äù Elliot Katz, Mixus co-founder, shared. ‚ÄúWhere is every person in the workforce today? For the most part, they‚Äôre on email. And so because we can do this through email, we believe that‚Äôs a way we can democratize access [to agents].‚Äù This innovative approach means users can interact with powerful AI agents simply by sending an email or a Slack message. Mixus, which only beta-launched out of Stanford in late 2024, has already garnered significant attention, raising $2.3 million in pre-seed funding and attracting customers such as the clothing store chain Rainbow Shops, alongside clients in finance and tech. The platform‚Äôs ease of use is its most compelling feature. Users can create single or multiple agents from simple text prompts, making complex AI tasks accessible to anyone, regardless of their technical expertise. Consider a sales professional needing to track overdue tasks: ‚ÄúCreate an agent that finds all open tasks in Jira in project mixus-dummy, and send me a report with information on all tasks that are overdue. Draft emails to all the assignees who have overdue tasks, and have me review them in the chat and with simple clear formatting for email (no attachments/docs). Once I verify, send the emails. Run it now. And moving forward, run it every Monday at 7am PST.‚Äù This level of intuitive command, executed directly through email AI , represents a significant leap forward in the AI agent space. While many existing tools offer pre-built assistants (like ChatGPT or Gemini) or require developers to build custom agents using frameworks such as LangChain, AutoGen, or crewAI, Mixus empowers everyday users to deploy sophisticated AI for their specific needs. Users can configure agents within Mixus‚Äôs platform via chat (written or vocal prompts) or by simply emailing instructions to agent@mixus.com. The platform then builds, runs, and manages these agents directly from the inbox. Unlocking Collaborative Workplace Automation with Shared Memory Beyond individual task management, Mixus excels in fostering collaborative workplace automation . Unlike most current models that are single-user focused, Mixus facilitates seamless teamwork. Bringing other colleagues into the workflow is as straightforward as tagging them in a chat with an agent or copying them on an email sent to the agent. This feature allows the AI to manage conversations and tasks between teammates in real time, a significant advancement over tools like Notion AI or Slack GPT, which primarily offer shared spaces without AI-driven task management between users. A core differentiator for Mixus is its robust memory function. ‚ÄúWe created Spaces so that every team, every person, every group of people can have a shared memory,‚Äù Magzimof explained. ‚ÄúThen all my agents, all my files, all the people can be in that very specific Space‚Äôs memory.‚Äù While leading AI models like ChatGPT and Claude offer memory capabilities, their enterprise plans do not yet support shared agent memory across multiple users. This shared memory capability means that agents can learn and adapt from collective team interactions, making them increasingly effective over time. The founders demonstrated the platform‚Äôs flexibility regarding human oversight. Organizations can establish company-wide rules, such as requiring human verification for external emails. However, for repetitive and proven tasks, such as a Jira integration that has run flawlessly hundreds of times, agents can operate autonomously. As Katz put it, ‚ÄúWe enable colleague oversight. We don‚Äôt mandate colleague oversight.‚Äù This balanced approach to human-in-the-loop AI ensures both efficiency and control. The Future of AI Agents: Mixus‚Äôs Comprehensive Capabilities and Impact Mixus‚Äôs capabilities extend far beyond simple email automation, positioning it as a comprehensive digital colleague rather than just a productivity tool. The platform‚Äôs AI agents can integrate with a wide array of existing tools, from Gmail to Jira, and can be triggered to run immediately or on a predefined schedule. A notable feature is the ability for agents to run and edit documents or spreadsheets inline, a capability seen in tools like ChatGPT, Microsoft Copilot, and Google Gemini, but often confined to sandboxed environments. Mixus elevates this by enabling agents to autonomously navigate organizational context, for instance, identifying task owners by analyzing Jira tickets. This cross-tool, organization-aware reasoning is a rare and powerful feature among today‚Äôs agent platforms. Built on a combination of Anthropic‚Äôs Claude 4 and OpenAI‚Äôs o3, Mixus agents also have access to the web, enabling tasks like live research and monitoring. Magzimof aptly described this as ‚ÄúGoogle Alerts on steroids.‚Äù The extensive demo showcased a range of use cases, from researching reporters to managing complex multi-step workflows, all reflecting a high degree of autonomy and memory. If Mixus performs as reliably in real-world scenarios as it did in demonstrations, it represents one of the most ambitious attempts yet to reimagine AI as a true collaborator. This innovative blend of advanced AI capabilities with accessible interfaces like email AI holds the promise of making sophisticated AI agents a practical reality for a much wider audience, democratizing powerful tools for everyday workplace automation . Mixus stands at the forefront of a new era for AI agents , addressing critical challenges of usability and integration by leveraging the familiarity of email. By prioritizing human-in-the-loop AI , fostering collaboration through shared memory, and offering intuitive controls, Mixus is poised to transform how businesses approach efficiency and productivity. This startup‚Äôs vision of a tireless digital colleague, deeply embedded in existing workflows, could indeed make your next ‚Äúcoworker‚Äù an AI that gets through your inbox faster than you do, truly unlocking the potential of AI for everyone. To learn more about the latest AI agents and workplace automation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI Models and their institutional adoption. This post AI Agents: Mixus Unlocks Seamless Workplace Automation via Email for a Revolutionary Future first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Surprising Decision from the World's Largest Bank, JPMorgan! "They're Preparing for a Major Bitcoin and Ethereum Move!"
body: According to the Financial Times, JPMorgan Chase is preparing for a new cryptocurrency move. JPMorgan is exploring offering loan products backed by cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH), the FT reported, citing multiple sources familiar with the matter. This will reportedly likely launch early next year. The move comes as major US banks like BoA and Citibank have shown interest in issuing stablecoins, and comes at a time when rules surrounding cryptocurrencies in the US are becoming clearer and customer demand is increasing. If JPMorgan's move goes through, it would mark a major shift for CEO Jamie Dimon, who once labeled Bitcoin a scam and predicted its collapse. Jamie Dimon, who has consistently expressed his skepticism towards Bitcoin, recently took a more flexible stance and said, ‚ÄúWe will be interested in stablecoins.‚Äù The CEO also expressed concerns about excessive leverage, illicit use, and money laundering risks at a May shareholder meeting, saying, ‚ÄúI don't like the Bitcoin ecosystem. If our customers want to buy BTC, we'll let them, but we won't store it.‚Äù *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Surprising Decision from the World's Largest Bank, JPMorgan! "They're Preparing for a Major Bitcoin and Ethereum Move!"
